intro: Toechima erythrocarpum subsp. papuanum, commonly known as the Papuan red-fruited balsam, is a flowering plant native to the highland regions of Papua. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related species. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white. Its fruits are fleshy, red berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. This subspecies is adapted to cool, moist environments and thrives in shaded forest understories.
